item.title: Intro To Assembly Programming From A Dummy
item.description: We are all comfortable writing code in high level languages like C, and some would even argue C is not a high level language like Java, or Python etc. But the truth is the more you go closer to the silicon, the more speed you get, trading away the traits of high level design (readability, maintainability etc). Here is an example of this. Long long ago, so long ago, I was seeing so many executable programs in my ~/bin directory, disturbing the auto-completion in the CLI.
